sense.name: Actively position oneself for comfort or cause an animate being to be in such a position.
sense.examples: We nestled against one another for warmth. The children nestled into their sleeping bags. The baby nestled her head in her mother's lap. I nestled into the couch to watch television. The rabbit nestled its head in my hands.

sense.name: (Cause to) be positioned in a geographically sheltered location.
sense.examples: We nestled our cabin deep in the forest. The castle nestled in the mountains outside town.
